content:
Has anyone done any research into this yet?

What is involved in adding this to a Backdrop CMS site (or should I say upgrading from old Google Analytics). I believe that there is a new tracking code. Does it just replace the old code or what?

I'll be doing some research on this, but hoping someone might help get me started.
I should post this to the forum.

https://www.blog.google/products/marketingplatform/analytics/new_google_analytics/

Introducing the new Google Analytics
The new Google Analytics will give you the essential insights you need to be ready for whatâ€™s next.
@StPaulTim the respective GA module for Drupal has an issue for it: https://www.drupal.org/project/google_analytics/issues/3178258
^^ that's the 7.x version, which doesn't have any activity yet (the issue was created about a week ago)
...the issue for 8.x is https://www.drupal.org/project/google_analytics/issues/3178179
...and it has a working patch available.
...by the looks of it, the only change is in the regex used in order to support the new format of the GA code (previous was UA-xxxxxxx-yy while the new version is G-xxxxxxxxx)
cc @jenlampton ^^

...by the way @jenlampton why do we have https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/googleanalytics as well as https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/google_analytics??

backdrop-contrib/googleanalytics
Adds the Google Analytics web statistics tracking system to your website. - backdrop-contrib/googleanalytics
backdrop-contrib/google_analytics
This is a mirror of https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/googleanalytics - backdrop-contrib/google_analytics
...both of these projects show a "Failed to load latest commit information." error for me.
image.png

klonos said:

...by the way jenlampton why do we have https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/googleanalytics as well as https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/google_analytics??

Because the module named changed from google_analytics to googleanalytics and people who search for google_analytics need to be able to find the project
We haven't adopted a policy on that yet, but there are a few options of ways we could handle it: * mirrors, *empty repos * redirects (theoretical)
I set up GA when we were trying option 1, but now I usually do option 2 instead
happy to go either way :)
I've always found the two repos confusing...

Don't suppose this helps in this situation... https://github.blog/2013-05-16-repository-redirects-are-here/

Repository redirects are here! - The GitHub Blog
It’s a fact of life – sometimes repository names change. This can happen in a few different types of scenarios: When you rename a repository. When you rename your user or organization account. When you

I was thinking about people coming from Drupal-land. https://www.drupal.org/project/googleanalytics seems to have been abandoned, and https://www.drupal.org/project/google_analytics seems to be the default project, with 320k+ installations.
yes, but inside the google_analytics project is a module named googleanalytics
